jmortgage.payment.extra
Class DefaultExtraPmt

java.lang.Object
  jmortgage.payment.extra.DefaultExtraPmt
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExtraPmt
public final class DefaultExtraPmt
extends Object
implements ExtraPmt

The default implementatiion of ExtraPmt. This object contains the amount of the extra payment, the number of payments to which the extra payment will be applied, and a PmtKey object. The PmtKey object indicates the start date of the extra payment. This start date must match exactly with the date of one of the regular mortgage payments. The PmtKey also indicates the interval of the extra payment. Valid interval values are Onetime, Yearly, Monthly, Biweekly, and Weekly. This object is immutable as long as the implementation of PmtKey it uses is immutable. DefaultPmtKey is immutable, so if this instance uses an implemntation of DefaultPmtKey, its thread safety is guaranteed.

Since:
1.0
Author:
David Armstrong

DefaultExtraPmt

public DefaultExtraPmt(PmtKey pmtKey,
                       Integer count,
                       Double amount)
Creates an object with the specified PmtKey instance, count, and amount. The count and amount values are passed in as Integer and Double values respectively. This constructor exists so clients can instantiate this object by using JMortgageFactory.getExtraPmt(java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class[], java.lang.Object[]), which uses reflection to build objects.

Parameters:
pmtKey - The PmtKey instance
count - The count value
amount - The amount value
Method Detail

getPmtKey

public PmtKey getPmtKey()
Gets the PmtKey object for this extra payment. The PmtKey object indicates the start date of the extra payment and the interval between extra payments.

Specified by:
getPmtKey in interface ExtraPmt
Returns:
PmtKey instantiation

getCount

public int getCount()
Gets the number of consecutive times to apply the extra payment. Consecutive is defined by the interval value indicated in the PmtKey object.

setPmtKey

public ExtraPmt setPmtKey(PmtKey pmtKey)
Sets the PmtKey instance. This method returns a new instance of DefaultExtraPmt. The object returned will use the specified PmtKey instance and will have the same count and amount values as the object on which setPmtKey was called.
